html:
Roles, voice types, premiere casts
Role[11] First version Revised Bologna version
Voice type Cast, 5 March 1868[12]
Conductor: Arrigo Boito
Elena (Helen of Troy) soprano Erminia Borghi-Mamo
Faust, a scholar baritone Italo Campanini
Margherita, a simple girl soprano Erminia Borghi-Mamo
Marta, Margherita's neighbour contralto Antonietta Mazzucco
Mefistofele bass Romano Nannetti
Nereo, a Greek elder Carlo Casarini
Pantalis, Helen's companion Antonietta Mazzucco
Wagner, Faust's pupil tenor Carlo Casarini
The Astrologer bass (no role)
Additional characters from the first version: The Herald; The Beggar; The Emperor; Lilith; Paris; A Boy; A Goblin
Chorus (second version): heavenly host, Chorus Mysticus, cherubim, penitents, strollers, crossbowmen, hunters, students, villagers, women of the people, middle class people, witches, warlocks, Greek chorus women,[14] Sirens, Nereids,[15] Greek coryphaei, warriors
